pullRequest.body:
This change defines the typeclasses `HasDetector` and `HasSeparator` for categories with detectors/separators. Several results for `IsDetector` and `IsSeparator` are also proved for the new typeclasses.

Convenience theorems for proving the well-poweredness of categories with separators are added, too.

Two typos are fixed: "separating" is corrected to "coseparating" in the module docstring and `IsCospearator.isCodetector` is renamed to `IsCoseparator.isCodetector`.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [7e958ef66e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18577/commits/7e958ef66e1059e41f6d5a58319be5439031d6b5)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ HasCodetector`
`+ HasCodetector.hasCoseparator`
`+ HasCodetector.hasDetector_of_hasCodetector_op`
`+ HasCodetector.hasDetector_op`
`+ HasCoseparator`
`+ HasCoseparator.hasCodetector`
`+ HasCoseparator.hasSeparator_of_hasCoseparator_op`
`+ HasCoseparator.hasSeparator_op`
`+ HasDetector`
`+ HasDetector.hasCodetector_of_hasDetector_op`
`+ HasDetector.hasCodetector_op`
`+ HasDetector.hasSeparator`
`+ HasDetector.wellPowered`
`+ HasSeparator`
`+ HasSeparator.hasCoseparator_of_hasSeparator_op`
`+ HasSeparator.hasCoseparator_op`
`+ HasSeparator.hasDetector`
`+ HasSeparator.wellPowered`
`+ IsCoseparator.isCodetector`
`+ codetector`
`+ coseparator`
`+ detector`
`+ hasCodetector_op_iff`
`+ hasCoseparator_op_iff`
`+ hasDetector_op_iff`
`+ hasSeparator_op_iff`
`+ isCodetector_codetector`
`+ isCodetector_coseparator`
`+ isCoseparator_codetector`
`+ isCoseparator_coseparator`
`+ isDetector_detector`
`+ isDetector_separator`
`+ isSeparator_detector`
`+ isSeparator_separator`
`+ separator`
`+ wellPowered_of_isSeparator`
`- IsCospearator.isCodetector`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
While `wellPowered_of_isSeparator` can be inlined quite trivially and might be unnecessary, I think `HasSeparator.wellPowered` can be actually useful. Happy to hear opinions on this :)

While applying the suggestions, I decided to make `C` implicit in `hasSeparator_op_iff` etc.. This way, one does not need to supply the category in `hasSeparator_op_iff.mp proof_hasSeparator_C_op`. I'd be interested what you think about that!

:v: datokrat can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11763825097/job/32768288858)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11763825097/job/32768289040)

Thanks!
bors d+

Thanks!
bors d+
Should we make these instances?

Regarding the first four at least, making them instances might lead to (at least logical) cycles during typeclass resolution. Would this be a problem? In the case of `HasColimits C` and `HasLimits Cᵒᵖ`, [hasColimits_of_hasLimits_op](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Limits/Opposites.html#CategoryTheory.Limits.hasColimits_of_hasLimits_op) is not an instance, other than [hasLimits_op_of_hasColimits](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Limits/Opposites.html#CategoryTheory.Limits.hasLimits_op_of_hasColimits), for example.

I think we could convert the `wellPowered` theorems into instances, there seems to be less of a danger of causing cycles...
I made the `wellPowered` theorems instances and left the others as is.

This syntax is [going away soon](https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/5542).
```suggestion
class HasSeparator : Prop where
```
It might be clearer to the reader to enclose the class definitions in a `section` that has `variable (C)`, otherthey they (like me) might wonder why you have to introduce a new category.
`hasCoseparator_op` and `hasSeparator_op` should be instances (and similarly for detectors below).
The naming convention suggests `hasCoseparator_of_hasSeparator_op` here.
I renamed the four applying theorems á la `HasSeparator.hasCoseparator_of_hasSeparator_op`.

This docstring sounds a bit strange to me, it almost makes it seem like there is some magic metaprogram that automatically instantiates `HasSeparator`.

You could consider going into a bit more detail that `HasSeparator` is `Prop`-valued, so users who care about specific objects being separators should use `IsSeparator` instead.

I think it might be nice to add
```lean
variable (C)
noncomputable def separator [HasSeparator C] : C :=
  Classical.indefiniteDescription _ (HasSeparator.hasSeparator) |>.1

theorem isSeparator_separator [HasSeparator C] : IsSeparator (separator C) :=
  Classical.indefiniteDescription _ (HasSeparator.hasSeparator) |>.2
```
for people who just want to quickly get hold of a separator using choice (similar to how `limit` is for `HasLimit`).

Sorry, I think I told you a suboptimal way to write this and the idiomatic way is
```suggestion
  HasSeparator.hasSeparator.choose
```
and similarly `HasSeparator.hasSeparator.choose_spec` for the specification theorem below.

```suggestion
Given a category `C` that has a separator (`HasSeparator C`), `separator C` is an arbitrarily
```
I think this change is no longer needed.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Generator): introduce classes HasDetector and HasSeparator
